# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
function wrap_string(text, text_width::Int = 10)
    lines = []
    for word in split(text)
        if length(word) + length(lines) > text_width
            push!(lines, "")
        end
        push!(lines, word)
    end
    return join(lines, "\n")
end

# Example usage:
text = "A very long string that needs to be wrapped into multiple lines."
println(wrap_string(text))
```

This function splits the text into words and then iterates over them, adding a new line to an array of strings (`lines`) whenever the combined length of the current word and the number of characters already in `lines` would exceed the specified `text_width`. Finally, it joins the lines back together with a newline character between each one, resulting in a multi-line string that fits within the specified width.
